Stranato fired at Dinobot. Inzola fired at Tavatron. Burning Hammer could
not decide which one he wanted, but Dinobot looked tougher...
----- Original Message -----
From: "Carnage darkness" <carnage_blood@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 19, 2000 10:28 PM
Subject: Move!




* Dinobot watched as his wishes came true, the duel had ended.rather
abruptly at that.
However, he didn't expect the 5 Alliance bots to suddenly decide to conform
Oblitertron, something that he would never look forward too.no matter how
desperate for battle he was.
With a growl he glanced over towards Tavatron, just wondering if the only
way to keep her safe was either to die trying.or get her to the CF as soon
as possible. Or at least before Oblitertron decided that they were better
targets then they seemed.
He then snapped his optics towards the huge bot once again, his teeth bared
and his entire body tense.
But there was something wrong, something very wrong! He was feeling light
headed and the ground beneath was covered in mech-fluid, and no matter when
he did the floe of fluid from his chest would not cease.his spark beating
too fast.
But, no matter how injured he was he wasn't about to fail in his mission, to
get Tavatron back to the CF.in one piece.
But then, all of a sudden he saw the huge bots optic lasers charge, aiming
right for Prowl.
He knew that his optic laser was failing along with its' sight, knowing that
he couldn't possibly hope to shoot that far.
Dinobot watched for one simple second, his mind reeling at what he saw.
Prowl had helped him get Tavatron back from the Alliance, and it was his
idea that had gotten them into their base and to the chamber where she had
been held. And for that, he owed him and was in his debt, because he had
helped bring Tavatron to safety.for a time.
And he was not a bot to leave his debts unpaid.
With more effort then it could have ever seemed, he was there. Right in
front of Prowl.swinging his clawed hand against the Maximals shoulder-plate
as hard as he could.*

"Fool! Move!!"

* He roared. Yet, just as his claws would have slammed against Prowl, the
optic lasers from the giant robot slammed into his side with a force which
sent both silver armor and fluid spraying into the air and showering each
with at least two gallons of mech-fluid.
Not a sound uttered from the warriors throat, his debt repaid. *
